title: Mouthiverse
description: Mouthiverse is a script developed by Vorace to simplify state switching in Adobe After Effects.

blocks.title: ‚Åò Welcome to the Mouthiverse ‚Åò
blocks.content:
Mouthiverse makes it easier to switch between the various states of an object by using labeled buttons in a dockable panel, avoiding the need to manually adjust a Slider Control.

It allows you to create and manage Mouthiverses: compositions containing multiple layers, each representing a different state of a visual element (e.g., mouth shapes for lip-syncing or other visual states).

It controls the visibility of each state through Opacity instead of Time Remapping for better performance and reliability.

tabs.title: Creating a New Mouthiverse
tabs.content:
Select two or more layers, click ‚ÄúNew Mouthiverse‚Äù, enter a name, width, and height, then click ‚ÄúCreate Mouthiverse‚Äú.

The script will create a new composition containing all selected layers and will update the Mouthiverse panel UI to display the newly created comp.

A Slider Control effect and Checkbox Control effect will be applied to the composition. With them you can also manually tweak the visibility of the states.

tabs.title: Converting an Existing Comp
tabs.content:
If you already have a composition for state switching that uses Time Remapping, you can convert it to a Mouthiverse by simply pressing the button ‚ÄúConvert‚Äù.

You can convert any composition used for state switching. The only requirement is that it must have a Slider Control that controls the states. The keyframes will be preserved and used.

While converting, the script will ask you if the first state corresponds to the value 0 of the Slider Control. If it doesn‚Äôt (for example if you used an expression to make the first state correspond to the value ‚Äú1‚Äù) you can input the offset to account for during the conversion.

tabs.title: Keyframes and Markers
tabs.content:
In the script panel, select the desired Mouthiverse and then click any of the buttons to place a keyframe corresponding to the selected state at the current time.

A marker will also be placed in correspondence with the keyframe. The marker will be colored as the layer that represent it inside the Mouthiverse.

To hide markers and prevent their creation, uncheck ‚ÄúShow Markers‚Äù.

RENDERING LOGIC:

‚åÇ ‚Üí ‚¨ó Markers follow keyframes: move the keyframes, then press ‚Äú‚Üª‚Äù to update markers positions.

‚¨ó ‚Üí ‚åÇ Keyframes follow markers: move the markers, then press ‚Äú‚Üª‚Äù to update the keyframes positions.

You can alternatively use the Slider Control named ‚Åò Mouthiverse ‚Åò and place keyframes traditionally.

tabs.title: Edit a Mouthiverse
tabs.content:
CHANGING NAMES:
You can freely change the name of a Mouthiverse composition and its layers inside as you wish.
DO NOT change the name of the effects applied by the script.

ADDING NEW LAYERS/STATES:
You can add new layers to the Mouthiverse, just make sure to put them at the bottom to avoid problems. Refresh ‚Äú‚Üª‚Äù when you are done adding layers.

EDIT EXISTING LAYERS/STATES:
Editing layers inside a Mouthiverse can be tricky because of the expression applied to the opacity of each layer‚Äôs opacity. To work around this, check the ‚Äú‚Åò Show All States ‚Åò‚Äù checkbox in the composition effects.

tabs.title: Important Notes
tabs.content:
REFRESHING:
The Refresh button (‚Äú‚Üª‚Äù) is a helpful tool to update all the Mouthiverses and the UI panel. Use it after making any major changes to Mouthiverses, its layers, keyframes or markers.

LAYERS ORDER MATTERS:
The top layer is the first state, the second layer is the second state, etc. Do not change the layer order after setting keyframes.

LAYERS LIMITATIONS:
The panel UI will display up to 24 buttons, so this is the maximum number of layers that can be inside a Mouthiverse.

LAYER VISIBILITY:
Only visible layers are included in state switching.

tabs.title: Troubleshooting
tabs.content:
NO LAYERS VISIBLE IN THE UI:
Ensure that you are in an active composition and that it contains a Mouthiverse, then click "‚Üª".
If the problem persists, check if there is a Slider Control named "‚Åò Mouthiverse ‚Åò" applied to the composition.

UNEXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
Try refreshing by clicking "‚Üª".
Avoid rearranging layers after setting keyframes and ensure all layers are visible.
